ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Kristinn, I have read the jdbc for the communication with database.I read the developer s manual also.I saw an example there.I tried to compile heritrix

Hello Kristinn,
  I have read the jdbc for the communication with
database.I read the developer's manual also.I saw an
example there.I tried to compile heritrix source with
example processor.But i found some errors at line
TextUtils.freeMatcher(match);  and
curi.addLinkToCollection(link,A_HTML_LINKS);  as
TextUtils does not have freeMatcher method and same
with curi(crawlUri) which has no method named
addLinkToCollection. I searched for the same in api
doc of heritrix . I did not find at all. If you have
any suggestion please do let me know. and also please
do let me know how  to plugin the same to heritrix
crawler.One morething i would like to clarify.Do All
system.out.print statements go to heritrix_out_log
file?


Regards
Sudhindra


--- Kristinn Sigurï¿½sson <kris@...> wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> If you are new to Java you should perhaps start by
> reading up on JDBC for
> the communications with the database.
> 
> As for the rest, the Developer's Manual for Heritrix
> has excellent
> information about how to write your own Processor:
>
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/ar01s11.html
> 
> No modifications to Heritrix's code base will be
> required! New processors
> plug in pretty easily. 
> 
> - Kris
> 
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> > [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf

> to MYSQL during crawl
> > 
> > Hello,
> > I was told to write a processor in heritrix so
> that it should 
> > take url and string as input and process the
> crawling if page 
> > contains the given string then that link should be
> written to 
> > mysql.Can anybody help me in this regard?
> > 
> > I am new to java. I donn't khow where to modify
> the heritrix 
> > code and configure the same in heritrix.
> > 
> > I don't want to store the content .i just want to
> store the 
> > matched link.
> > 
> > Thanks in advance
> > Sudhindra Joshi
